Noticed this problem when reading |beg_ref_slug|joneslogan_realpython_2018_managingmultiplepythonversionspyenv|end_ref_slug|, then following Rodrigo Veraâ€™s advice about installing additional sdk headers. I am using Catalina.

Tip: When running Mojave or higher (10.14+) you will also need to install the additional SDK headers:

>>> sudo installer -pkg /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/Packages/macOS_SDK_headers_for_macOS_10.14.pkg -target /

Trying to follow that advice, I got an invalid package path install error:

 /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/Packages/macOS_SDK_headers_for_macOS_10.14.pkg

Did some digging and discover that Catalina stores the headers in a different place.

>>> xcrun --sdk macosx --show-sdk-path

Resulting Path: /Library/Developer/CommandLineTools/SDKs/MacOSX.sdk

The underlying problem is that you need the C or C++ |beg|Makefile|end| to find the flags they need to organize the code for compiling and linking. Mac seems to shift locations for these headers with every major release, so it is a big pain. Pillow and Pyenv both rely on C programs that do not specify the correct location in Catalina.

The following links offer possible solutions: 1. |beg_ref_slug|bengtssonpeter_20200219_buildpyenvpythonversionsmacoscatalina1015|end_ref_slug|, 2. |beg_ref_slug|github_pyenv_issues_1348|end_ref_slug|, and 3. |beg_ref_slug|allanrob_20191127_installingpillowcatalina|end_ref_slug|

But my plan is to try

>>> export CPATH=`xcrun --show-sdk-path`/usr/include

and then restart my terminal. This is from |beg_ref_slug|allanrob_20191127_installingpillowcatalina|end_ref_slug|. Hopefully Pyenv along with any other package that requires zlib or other standard headers will now install.
